node.title: Carer for disabled daughter wins right to be employed by Ministry of Health
node.description: The Employment Court has agreed with the parent and fulltime carer of a severely disabled woman, that he is employed by the Ministry of Health and not his daughter.

node.title: Joan Semmel Takes an Unflinching View of Her Own Body
node.description: The painter, 89, has never shied away from erotic imagery. Her signature nude self-portraits are an attempt to see herself through her own eyes.

node.title: ‘France’ Review: When the Journalist Becomes the Story
node.description: Léa Seydoux plays a star television anchor whose life comes unraveled in Bruno Dumont’s new film.

node.title: Ron DeSantis Beats Every Republican in Hypothetical 2024 Matchup if Trump Doesn't Run
node.description: "All the speculation about me is purely manufactured," DeSantis said in September when asked about a potential run for the presidency in 2024

node.title: The Met Removes Sackler Family Name From Museum's Galleries Following Opioid Controversy
node.description: The Sackler name will be stripped from seven exhibition spaces in the famous New York City museum.

node.title: Tasmanian health department put interests of alleged paedophile ahead of victims, review finds
node.description: Tasmania's health department is accused of putting the interests of alleged paedophile nurse James Griffin ahead of his victims in a scathing review by the state's Ombudsman.

node.title: Australia dumps troubled European-designed Taipan helicopters for US Black Hawks and Seahawks
node.description: The Army will follow the Navy's decision to replace its locally produced Airbus MRH-90s with off-the-shelf Sikorsky-manufactured helicopters, in a move expected to cost billions of dollars.

node.title: Aucklanders locked out of housing market by 'criminal' prices
node.description: A regular 20 percent deposit on a lower quartile Auckland home is $20,000 more than at the end of last year, and $40,000 more than two years ago.

node.title: Starbucks workers vote for a union in upstate New York
node.description: More than 80 baristas and shift supervisors from three Buffalo-area stores approve/reject joining labor group.

node.title: Starbucks workers at a Buffalo store form union in a contentious vote.
node.description: The coffee chain’s executives sought to convince workers to reject the union in an election campaign that began in late August.

node.title: Gig Workers in Europe May Be Reclassified Under Proposed Rules, Get More Money, Benefits
node.description: The European Commission estimated this could reclassify up to 4.1 million gig workers for digital and app-based services such as ridesharing and meal delivery.

node.title: Here's How You Could Be Entitled to Payments From Zoom
node.description: The payments are part of a settlement of a class action lawsuit that alleged that Zoom shared users' information with third parties.

node.title: TikToker's Viral Gym Hack Impresses Internet: 'Modern Problems Require Modern Solutions'
node.description: "No man has tried to correct my form since smearing brown eyeshadow on my neck like hickeys," read the video's text overlay.

node.title: After 20 years, the Cat Empire will disband, but not before a fairytale finish
node.description: Their energetic performances have always invited music-lovers to dance and sing along. Now the members of Melbourne's iconic band the Cat Empire say it's time for a change.

node.title: Face masks help protect us from COVID. But we need to protect the planet from that plastic pollution
node.description: Australia has been warned to guard against a massive COVID face mask litter problem that could last generations.

node.title: England 'not on the ropes', Travis Head says despite blistering century
node.description: Travis Head's stunning 85-ball century on day two of the first Ashes Test at the Gabba looks to have taken the game away from England, but Australia's centurion says there is still work to be done.

node.title: Freight movements data further sign economic activity is on the move
node.description: Freight movements continue to rebound as coronavirus restrictions are eased across the country.

node.title: 'Appalling state of affairs' in Reefton due to anti-vaxxers - ICB chair
node.description: The irrational attitude of anti-vaxxers is damaging Reefton's hospitality, health services, and reputation, says Inangahua Community Board's chairperson.

node.title: Murder of Pennsylvania teacher remains unsolved
node.description: The case of Rachael DelTondo, of a young teacher killed steps from her home, is still unsolved over three years later,. A person of interest in her murder was convicted in another homicide.

node.title: Review: ‘And Just Like That,’ It All Went Wrong
node.description: The “Sex and the City” revival is part dramedy about heartbreak, part awkward bid at relevance.

node.title: American Airlines will trim international flights because of Boeing 787 delays.
node.description: The carrier was expecting 13 Dreamliners this winter, but Boeing has delayed those deliveries, the latest sign that it is struggling to overcome problems that have eroded its credibility.

node.title: Senate Clears Last Hurdle to Raising Debt Ceiling
node.description: Fourteen Republicans joined Democrats in voting to take up legislation that would pave the way for Congress to raise the debt ceiling by a simple majority vote, skirting a filibuster.

node.title: WHO Warns Against Widespread Use of Booster Shots to Avoid Vax Shortage in Poorer Nations
node.description: "What is going to shut down disease is for everybody who is especially at risk of disease to become vaccinated," Dr. Kate O'Brien said.

node.title: Capitol Police Investigating How Congressional Staffer With Gun Bypassed Security
node.description: Jeffrey Allsbrooks works in the office of the House chief administrative officer and said he forgot that the gun was in his bag.

node.title: Bigler Stouffer II Executed in Oklahoma for 1985 Shooting Death of Teacher Linda Reaves
node.description: Stouffer was executed by lethal injection on Thursday morning. His final words were: "My request is that my father forgive them. Thank you."

node.title: Entering the 'red zone' - A look inside an Auckland Covid-19 ward
node.description: Checkpoint reporter Louise Ternouth and camera operator Marika Khabazi head into the red zone and talk to those at the frontline about their challenges and hopes. Audio

node.title: Daunte Wright was "just gasping" after shooting, girlfriend testifies
node.description: The woman who was riding with Daunte Wright​ when he was pulled over by police testified about the chaos right after an officer shot him.

node.title: What Your Microwave Can Do for You
node.description: After years without one, I’m learning to love this appliance.

node.title: Volkswagen’s C.E.O. stays on board, but loses some responsibilities.
node.description: Herbert Diess, who angered workers by mentioning the possibility of job cuts, will hand over some authority to a deputy.

node.title: A Surge in Trading Preceded Trump’s SPAC Deal
node.description: Trading in the merger partner’s warrants, which allow holders to buy shares later, spiked several times before the Trump Media agreement was made public.
